E2E Test Case Study - TechCorp E-commerce Platform

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
TechCorp is a growing e-commerce company that needs to modernize their platform to handle increasing traffic and improve reliability. They currently serve 50,000 customers across North America and Europe.

BUSINESS REQUIREMENTS:
- Support 10,000 concurrent users during peak shopping periods
- Achieve 99.9% uptime to minimize revenue loss
- Process payments securely with PCI DSS compliance
- Expand to global markets with low latency
- Reduce operational costs by 30%
- Enable rapid feature deployment (weekly releases)

CURRENT ARCHITECTURE CHALLENGES:
- Single region deployment in US-East
- Monolithic application architecture
- Manual scaling processes
- Basic security controls
- No disaster recovery plan
- Limited monitoring and alerting
- High operational overhead

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:
- Web application tier: Handle dynamic content and user sessions
- Database tier: Store product catalog, user data, and order history  
- Payment processing: Secure credit card transactions
- Content delivery: Fast loading of product images and videos
- Search functionality: Product search with filtering and recommendations
- Integration: Third-party logistics and payment providers

COMPLIANCE AND SECURITY:
- PCI DSS Level 1 compliance for payment card data
- GDPR compliance for European customers
- SOC 2 Type II certification
- Data encryption at rest and in transit
- User authentication and authorization
- Audit logging for all transactions

PERFORMANCE GOALS:
- Page load time < 2 seconds globally
- API response time < 500ms
- Database query performance < 100ms average
- Auto-scaling during traffic spikes
- Support 100x traffic growth over 2 years

AVAILABILITY AND RELIABILITY:
- 99.9% uptime requirement (8.77 hours downtime/year max)
- RTO (Recovery Time Objective): 4 hours
- RPO (Recovery Point Objective): 1 hour
- Multi-region active-passive setup
- Automated failover capabilities

OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
- Infrastructure as Code for all deployments
- Automated testing and deployment pipelines
- Real-time monitoring and alerting
- Cost optimization and governance
- 24/7 support coverage
- Capacity planning and forecasting

This case study provides a comprehensive scenario for testing the Well-Architected Framework assessment capabilities across all five pillars: Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, Cost Optimization, and Operational Excellence.
